maxflow14.graph

Class Flow

  • java.lang.Object
    • maxflow14.graph.Flow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Flow
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class models a network with flow values, N:=(V,E,s,t,c,f), and provides methods for interaction
    See Also:
    Graph, Serialized Form

      • getOutgoingFlow

        public double getOutgoingFlow(int vid)
        Returns:
        the sum of all flow values leaving vertex v (given its id)

      • edgeInRest

        public boolean edgeInRest(int u,
                 int v)
        Returns:
        tells if the given edge is present in the residual network

      • edgeInRestValue

        public double edgeInRestValue(int u,
                     int v)
        Returns:
        returns edges capacities in the residual network for given IDs (u,v)

      • isFlow

        public boolean isFlow(int u,
             int v)
        Returns:
        If flow on the edge (u,v) is set to a positive value

      • getFlow

        public double getFlow(int u,
             int v)
        Returns:
        flow value on edge (u,v)

      • getIncomingFlow

        public double getIncomingFlow(int vid)
        Returns:
        sum of flow values on edges (*,v) for a given vertex ID v

      • getResidualNetwork

        public Graph getResidualNetwork()
        Returns:
        the Residual network for the current graph and flow values

      • getBaseNetwork

        public Graph getBaseNetwork()
        Returns:
        the flow network N:=(V,E,s,t,c) that is being worked on
        See Also:
        Graph

      • getResidualEdges

        public java.util.HashSet<Edge>[] getResidualEdges()
        Returns:
        a two-dimensional array Set[] with two sets, first the "forward" edges in the residual network, then the "backwards" edges

      • isFlowAllowed

        public boolean isFlowAllowed()
        Returns:
        tells if the flow meets the "flow sustainment" condition, i.e. exc(v)=0 for all v except s,t and exc(t)=-exc(s)
        See Also:
        PushRelabel

      • getFlowMap

        public Graph getFlowMap()
        Returns:
        a graph that contains the original vertex set, but only edges between vertices where positive flow values are set, and with the flow values as capacities.
        See Also:
        Graph, GraphPanel.drawRightEK_Flow(EdmondsKarp)
